ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I believe the class could be made much more helpful for students if it could include more personal reflection exercises such as for example personal strength and weakness assessments - discuss the results in class. Team learning exercises, simulations --> powerful exercises that are fit for a course like this and not done elsewhere in another F&ES class. But only talking about topics is time not well used. It was however interesting to get an insight into GE functioning etc. there was however a lot of repetition.

I was quite surprised by the lack of structure for this course. There was a huge opportunity for the class to practice and exercise leadership fundamentals in the context of the environmental space, and it didn't happen. Often times people who become managers are promoted to such positions without really fully acquiring the skills necessary to be effective leaders. If that was not the case here, I'm disappointed we didn't get to tap into that knowledge. There is no doubt the instructor had the background, knowledge and expertise in her field, but in my opinion, wasn't able to demonstrate through hindsight and reflection that she possessed the skills necessary to be an effective leader; and therefore impart wisdom on how to become a leader. I understand that knowing how to navigate the winds of corporate America is a skill in itself, but that wasn't the title of the class.
The course was useful to learn of real case examples of how environmental leadership and management works.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Insights into personal experience of GE as company from working in sustainability/environment division. (can be reduced to 1 class time - rest used on more exercises to learn) Best section was the Human Resources guest lecturer.
Kristen's weather of knowledge and being able to speak freely with her and ask queestions.
Having opportunity to interact with Kris and talk about her experiences and get her advice was really valuable. Getting some 'real-world' discussion was just great.
That we could work on a final project to understand the concepts.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: content - adapt to be more useful to students and more than just verbal reflections but add experimenting and self-discovery elements (what leader I want to be, what are my strenghts & weaknesses) then tie back to how these are used in GE. --> there are a lot of such resources out there, available.
Most of it. It lacked structure and purpose.
More material could be included as well as more discussion of case studies.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: see above
The material included on classes V2 could be discussed in class to understand some concepts better.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Important for my focus/specialization at F&ES
It was useful to learn from others' experiences and perspectives about leadership and management.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: see above
I was hoping to take away some wisdom and hindsight from an experienced "leader", to help me tweak my management philosophy, and shape who I want to become as a future leader.

Wanted to get some perspective from someone who works in the corporate world on environmental issues. I'm not necessarily interested in doing it myself, but it was great to hear from someone who has that experience. It's nice to get some 'real-world' perspective after being so in the academic world for a while.
Because I wanted to learn tips and recommendations to be an effective leader in environmental management roles.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: no
No. Unfortunately.
Yes.
It was good but I would have liked to learn more about different examples of discussions of different topics.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Fun and creative exercise-learning: presentation skills? Professor can be more strict.
Advantages. We were able to divide and conquer the work so as to put together a comprehensive presentation in a short period of time.
It was a good experience to participate in a group work and everyone in the group collaborated and I think we learned more because we could understand the concepts better.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Very easy 1 credit option. Content is not very work heavy. Pizza! Only six week class.
Do it, nothing to lose. It's fun and a nice break from other classes.
If you take it, take advantage of the opportunity to ask about work in general, not just about 'the corporate world' type of work. Also, take her advice (as with anything) with a grain of salt.
It is a course in which you can learn from the experience of the professor and you can get a better understanding of some topics with the group project.
